items.title: Atlassian Home
items.description: A portal page to access your Atlassian services.

items.title: Vercel
items.description: Hosting solution by the developers of Next.js.

items.title: npm
items.description: Node.js package directory and package manager.

items.title: 30 seconds of code
items.description: Short code snippets for repeating programming tasks.

items.title: 1loc
items.description: Collection of one liner functions and code.

items.title: BundlePhobia
items.description: Check bundle size of npm packages.

items.title: up-to.date/?
items.description: Check which version of a package or software is the latest.

items.title: AlternativeTo
items.description: Find alternatives to some given technology.

items.title: StackShare
items.description: A service that let's you analyze and manage your technology stack. You can also browse other company's stacks.

items.title: Chrome Developers
items.description: Official developer resources about Chrome Browser.

items.title: Chrome Web Store Developer Dashboard
items.description: Official Dashboard to manage Chrome Extensions, Themes, etc.

items.title: Firefox Add-On Developer Hub
items.description: Official Dashboard to manage Firefox Extensions.

items.title: DevDocs
items.description: Collection of language and library documentations.

items.title: Read the Docs
items.description: Service for writing documentation for your libraries.

items.title: MDN
items.description: Web technology documentation (HTML, CSS, JS, Browser APIs, etc.) by Mozilla.

items.title: devhints.io
items.description: A list of cheatsheets by Rico Sta. Cruz.

items.title: Emmet Cheat Sheet
items.description: The official cheat sheet for Emmet - the editor shortcuts to quickly write HTML.

items.title: BEM
items.description: A CSS naming convention that groups classes using namespaces.

items.title: Learn X in Y minutes
items.description: Resources to learn languages or tools in X minutes.

items.title: Type Level TypeScript
items.description: A course to learn TypeScript in-depth.

items.title: Tailwind CSS
items.description: A utility class based CSS framework.

items.title: MUI
items.description: React component library with different design languages, including Material UI, and an unstyled version of every component.

items.title: Material Design
items.description: Official documentation for Google's Material Design.

items.title: Preact
items.description: Fast and small alternative to React with the same API.

items.title: Lit
items.description: A library for building web components.

items.title: Alpine.js
items.description: A library that attaches JS logic to the DOM.

items.title: HTMX
items.description: A library to add logic to HTML by using attributes.

items.title: Hotwire
items.description: Hotwire is an alternative approach to building modern web applications without using much JavaScript by sending HTML instead of JSON over the wire. (Hotwire = Turbo + Stimulus)

items.title: Turbo
items.description: The speed of a single-page web application without having to write any JavaScript.

items.title: Stimulus
items.description: A modest JavaScript framework for the HTML you already have.

items.title: JS web framework benchmark
items.description: A performance benchmark table for many JS web frameworks.

items.title: Ionic
items.description: A framework for hybrid mobile apps.

items.title: Electron
items.description: A framework to build native desktop apps using the web stack.

items.title: Tauri
items.description: A framework to build native desktop apps using the web stack and Rust.

items.title: Blazor
items.description: Compile C# to WASM and run it in the Browser.

items.title: Flutter
items.description: A Dart based framework to build multi-platform apps.

items.title: Jotai
items.description: Atomic state management library for React similar to Recoil.

items.title: Recoil
items.description: An experimental new state management library for React by Facebook Open Source. (Seems to be deprecated now with Jotai as its alternative!)

items.title: Socket.io
items.description: Bidirectional and low-latency communication for every platform.

items.title: TanStack Query
items.description: Powerful asynchronous state management for TS/JS, React, Solid, Vue and Svelte.

items.title: Zod
items.description: TypeScript-first schema validation with static type inference

items.title: Headless UI
items.description: Unstyled UI components for React and Vue by the developers of Tailwind CSS.

items.title: date-fns
items.description: date-fns provides the most comprehensive, yet simple and consistent toolset for manipulating JavaScript dates in a browser & Node.js.

items.title: Autoprefixer
items.description: Library that automatically insert browser prefixes into your CSS.

items.title: Create React App
items.description: A starter template for React apps.

items.title: Biome
items.description: A universal build chain that includes a linter, compiler, bundler, and more. It's the successor of Rome.

items.title: webhint
items.description: Linting tool that checks your website's accessibility, speed, cross-browser compatibility, and more.

items.title: Puppeteer
items.description: API to control and automate a browser without showing its UI.

items.title: EditorConfig
items.description: Control some text editor settings by using a config file.

items.title: OWASP Cheat Sheet Series Project
items.description: Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Cheat Sheets.

items.title: The Twelve-Factor App
items.description: A methodology for building modern, scalable, maintainable software-as-a-service apps.

items.title: Semver
items.description: A detailed description of the versioning schema "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH".

items.title: Gitmoji
items.description: An emoji guide for your commit messages.

items.title: Definitely Typed
items.description: Find npm packages that have type declarations, either bundled or on Definitely Typed.

items.title: nvm
items.description: Node.js version manager for macOS and Linux.

items.title: NVM for Windows
items.description: Node.js version manager for Windows. (Notice: The developers are working on a successor called "Runtime". NVM for Windows will be deprecated as soon as Runtime gets released.)

items.title: TypeSpec
items.description: A language by Microsoft to describe data and to generate API specs, client and server code, docs, etc.

items.title: Google Webfonts Helper
items.description: A web service that helps to self-host fonts from Google Fonts.

items.title: Ic√¥nes
items.description: A collection of many icon sets. You can search for icons in all icon sets at once.

items.title: Pictogrammers
items.description: A collection of open-source icons including "Material Design Icons".

items.title: Heroicons
items.description: Icons by the developers of Tailwind CSS.

items.title: Simple Icons
items.description: Collection of single colored brand logos.

items.title: Subtle Patterns
items.description: A collection of subtle background patterns (by Toptal).

items.title: Transparent Textures
items.description: A collection of transparent background patterns.

items.title: Can I use...
items.description: Check browser compatibility of various language features and browser APIs.

items.title: Can I email...
items.description: Check e-mail client compatibility of various language features.

items.title: Can I DevTools...
items.description: Check which devtools support which debugging action.

items.title: Web Platform Status
items.description: A website to check which browser supports which web platform features. Initially developed by Google.

items.title: Node Green
items.description: Table that illustrates which Node.js version supports which ECMAScript features.

items.title: Is Houdini ready yet?
items.description: Table that illustrates the current development status of Houdini in all major browsers.

items.title: Timeline of Web Browsers
items.description: A graphical timeline of all web browsers, grouped by used engine.

items.title: ECMAScript Proposals
items.description: Official repository of all ECMAScript proposals.

items.title: ECMAScript Compatibility Table
items.description: Table illustrating browser support of ECMAScript features.

items.title: Mozilla Specification Positions
items.description: A list of Mozilla's position on open web and web-related specifications.

items.title: TC39
items.description: Official website of Ecma International's TC39 (Technical Committee 39).

items.title: TC39 Forum
items.description: Official forum of Ecma International's TC39 (Technical Committee 39). Talk about ECMAScript features and proposals.

items.title: WICG
items.description: Official website of the WICG (Web Incubator Community Group).

items.title: Open UI
items.description: Official website of Open UI (a W3C community group). It's about making built-in form controls styleable while also adding new ones.

items.title: JetBrains
items.description: Developer of IDEs like IntelliJ, PHPStorm, WebStorm, etc.

items.title: Frontend Focus
items.description: Newsletter with news about web frontend development.
